Status (2010-06-17) - SharpNEAT 2 Candidate Release
-----------------------=
----------------------------
SharpNEAT 2 development has reached candidate =
release status. This
is a fully functional release that is made available i=
n order to
highlight any defects before issuing the code as an official ver=
sion
2.0

Features:
   * Parallel execution. Concurrent genome decoding and=
 genome
evaluation, also concurrent speciation by k-means clustering.
Imple=
mented using Parallel Extensions (built-in to .Net 4, available
as a separa=
te library for compiling within Mono).
   * Support for both NEAT and Hyper=
NEAT/CPPNs.
   * Generic framework classes with high level of abstraction a=
nd
therefore flexibility and reusability in both NEAT and non-NEAT
projects=
.
   * Flexible XML configuration.
   * XML IO for genomes and populations.=

   * Problem domains -
         o Logical XOR.
         o Binary 3-multipl=
exer, 6-multiplexer & 11-multiplexer.
         o Function regression - sin(=
x), sin(x^2) & multiplication
(with visualization).
         o Boxes Visual=
 Discrimination (with visualization). (see
http://eplex.cs.ucf.edu/publicat=
ions/2009/stanley.alife09.html)
         o Prey Capture (with visualization=
).
         o Single Pole Balancing
         o Double Pole Balancing (and v=
ariants)

   * Speciation by k-means clustering (Single thread and parallel=

versions). To my knowledge this is the first NEAT implementation to
use th=
is approach and as such this code is experimental. Results so
far have been=
 positive.
   * Complexity Regulation (previously known as phased pruning).=

   * GUI for modifying experiment parameters, controlling the
execution of=
 the evolution algorithm and visualization of genomes and
problem domains.
=


Cheers,

Colin
